heisig_chinese_memo: The most snooty prim and proper English Lord with white gloves clapping only with his fingers so as to make no racquet at all. "Oh bravo old chap. Bravo...".
koohiiStory1: (Image: the most snooty prim and proper English Lord with white gloves clapping only with his fingers. "Oh bravo old chap. Bravo...").
koohiiStory2: I clapped so hard, my fingers became white.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You're tapping your fingers against a white wall when you realize the sound you're making is actually a sick beat. You keep going and start singing along. Boo boo boop. Boo do do do doop! Finger beats!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself in a completely white room. All you have is the white walls, your fingers, and your beats. When you stop all you're left with is white noise. Yuck! Keep those beats coming!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This beat is sick, but as you tap you realize you're hacking („ÅØ„Åè) up the wall! Slowly but surely, your fingers are hacking out little bits of the wall. And the beats don't sound as good until you move to a new, clean white area.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine hacking the wall apart as you try to keep this beat going. The music is all you have, man! You can't lose the beat now!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: hands (Êâå) make white (ÁôΩ) (noise) when they clap
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The most snooty prim and proper English Lord with white gloves clapping only with his fingers so as to make no racquet at all. "Oh bravo old chap. Bravo...".
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The inscription from the " hand " to the " white " sound, the initial meaning of the configuration is unknown, from the hand it is suspected that it will slap with the palm of the hand. Bronze writing is used as a person's name. Xiaozhu " Pai " is made " ¢´¶ ", "Shuowen": "¢´¶, Êãä‰πü. Congshou, Baisheng." "Jiyun": "¢´¶, Yinmo. Hit also. Also make pat." "Han Feizi‚Äß Fame": "Shoot with one hand, although sick and silent."

" Bai " can mean a tool for beating, and ancient books are used as weapons. "Chen Shu¬∑Hou Lai Biography": "General battle, there is a breeze from the southeast, all the troops patted and set fire."

The chapter unit of the music, such as the beat of the music, is also called " beat ". Song Shenkuo's "Mengxi Bi Tan-Le Lu Yi": "Nowadays, stick drums are often just patted. There are few special solos."

Chanting can also be called " shooting. " Tang Luyan "Qixi": "Father and son were born with two, so good singing is not easy to shoot." Original note: "Taking, Yin Ye."

Modern Chinese " beat " also said that shooting, such as "camera", "movie" and so on.
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " hand ", " white " sound, the initial meaning of the configuration is unknown, from the hand, it is suspected that it will slap the palm.

Shoot
Basic explanation of words
Shoot
pƒÅi
Hit with the palm: slap. Clap your hands. Pat. Absolutely.
Waves hit: hit the shore.
Apparatus for tapping things: beat (also a unit for calculating the length of music).
The rhythm of the music: beat.
Photography: shooting. Take pictures. Filming.
Send: pat to send. wire.
Flattering, fawning: flattering. Blow, blow, pat.
Shoot
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]ÔºªpƒÅiÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Puber cut, enters the street, and peng. ]
"Áöõ2" was passed falsely.
(1) Pat with the palm of your hand.
(2) Strike; fight.
(3) Apparatus used for slap.
(4) Names of ancient weapons. Instant rod.
(5) Intimacy; flattery.
(6) Full.
(7) Bye.
(8) The chapter unit of the music. Yushou.
(9) Refers to the tempo of the music.
(10) Refers to the clappers of ancient musical instruments.
(11) Chanting.
(12) Say.
(13) Shoot and send.
(14) Shooting.
(15) Onomatopoeia. The sound of an object hitting, ejecting, bursting, or landing.

‚ô´ –ó–∞–Ω—è–≤—à–µ–º—É –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –≥—Ä–æ–º–∫–æ –ø–æ—Ö–ª–æ–ø–∞–ª–∏ (1-–π —Ç–æ–Ω).

Radicals: Êâå, ÁôΩ  (fingers, white)
Meaning Mnemonic
You're tapping your fingers against a white wall when you realize the sound you're making is actually a sick beat. You keep going and start singing along. Boo boo boop. Boo do do do doop! Finger beats!
Imagine yourself in a completely white room. All you have is the white walls, your fingers, and your beats. When you stop all you're left with is white noise. Yuck! Keep those beats coming!
Reading Mnemonic
This beat is sick, but as you tap you realize you're hacking („ÅØ„Åè) up the wall! Slowly but surely, your fingers are hacking out little bits of the wall. And the beats don't sound as good until you move to a new, clean white area.
Imagine hacking the wall apart as you try to keep this beat going. The music is all you have, man! You can't lose the beat now!
